paragraphs.body: Methods of transportation in the ${link_0} vary greatly from nation to nation, ranging from motorized transportation, like ${link_1}, to ${link_2}-based transportation, such as ${link_3}.
paragraphs.text: Methods of transportation in the Avatar World vary greatly from nation to nation, ranging from motorized transportation, like tank trains, to animal-based transportation, such as flying bison.

paragraphs.body: Prior to the ${link_0}, the ${link_1} and the ${link_2} relied exclusively on unpowered transportation methods, whereas the ${link_3} and ${link_4} had more advanced methods at their disposal.
paragraphs.text: Prior to the Hundred Year War, the Air Nomads and the Water Tribe relied exclusively on unpowered transportation methods, whereas the Earth Kingdom and Fire Nation had more advanced methods at their disposal.

paragraphs.body: Seventy years after the war's end, motorized transportation evolved significantly and became a typical sight within ${link_0}.
paragraphs.text: Seventy years after the war's end, motorized transportation evolved significantly and became a typical sight within Republic City.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} provided the ${link_1} with quick and reliable airborne transportation.
paragraphs.text: Flying bison provided the Air Nomads with quick and reliable airborne transportation.

paragraphs.body: The Air Nomads' use of ${link_0} extends to transportation. Without any external means of travel, Air Nomads can run great distances at high speeds. However, for longer journeys or for some applications, the Air Nomads make use of flying bison and gliders.
paragraphs.text: The Air Nomads' use of airbending extends to transportation. Without any external means of travel, Air Nomads can run great distances at high speeds. However, for longer journeys or for some applications, the Air Nomads make use of flying bison and gliders.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} were also used in ice dodging, a rite of passage in the ${link_1}.
paragraphs.text: Cutter sailing ships were also used in ice dodging, a rite of passage in the Southern Water Tribe.

paragraphs.body: The people of the Water Tribe always inhabit regions near water. Thus, their methods of transportation are mostly water-based, with a small variety of boats and larger ships used.
paragraphs.text: The people of the Water Tribe always inhabit regions near water. Thus, their methods of transportation are mostly water-based, with a small variety of boats and larger ships used.

paragraphs.body: An ${link_0}, part of the fleet which transported refugees across the ${link_1}.
paragraphs.text: An Earth Kingdom ferry, part of the fleet which transported refugees across the East and West Lakes.

paragraphs.body: The Earth Kingdom is vast and thus has a large variety of transportation for every need. Various methods emphasize speed, agility, or luxury.
paragraphs.text: The Earth Kingdom is vast and thus has a large variety of transportation for every need. Various methods emphasize speed, agility, or luxury.

paragraphs.body: The ${link_0} traverses the city's three rings.
paragraphs.text: The monorail traverses the city's three rings.

paragraphs.body: The industrialized Fire Nation has many transportation methods. Some of them are among the fastest in the world, driven by steam. Others are more traditional, such as the palanquin.
paragraphs.text: The industrialized Fire Nation has many transportation methods. Some of them are among the fastest in the world, driven by steam. Others are more traditional, such as the palanquin.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} function by being less dense than the surrounding air.
paragraphs.text: Hot air balloons function by being less dense than the surrounding air.

paragraphs.body: The ${link_0} was invented by ${link_1} as an affordable ${link_2}.
paragraphs.text: The Satomobile was invented by Hiroshi Sato as an affordable motor vehicle.
Republic City has an extensive trolley network.

source.title: Transportation in the World of Avatar
